definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat

sentences.english: Today girls are going for the women's individual all-around final.
sentences.chinese: 今天女孩子們要爲個人全能拼搏了。

sentences.english: Like the sea of science, and require desperate struggle.
sentences.chinese: 科學如同大海，要求奮不顧身的拼搏。

sentences.english: Real man dare to combatant and he knows also to protect himself and family.
sentences.chinese: 真男人要敢於拼搏，也要懂得保護自己和家人。

sentences.english: See ShangQian struggle, zhuo or will inform ShangQian exclusive news.
sentences.chinese: 看見尚謙的拼搏行徑，卓或便將獨家消息告知尚謙。

sentences.english: Love you and you will work together, otherwise why bother to take youth gambling tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 愛你纔會和你一起拼搏，不然何苦拿青春賭明天。

sentences.english: But what I admire most about them is their competitive spirit.
sentences.chinese: 不過我最佩服的還是他們的拼搏精神。

sentences.english: He was fighting, he was strong in duels .
sentences.chinese: 今天他是在拼搏，他在對抗中表現得很強壯。

sentences.english: We struggle because we want to improve ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我們拼搏努力，因爲我們渴望提升我們自己。

sentences.english: But it was great that we all rose above it and got out there and started playing again.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們全體將士都拼搏向上，並重新起航走出陰霾。

sentences.english: I don't know if this is true, but it seems to work for power lifters and martial-arts gurus.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道這是否屬實，但是好像在拼搏的時候很有效。

sentences.english: In addition, the trampolinists need developing collective spirit and combatant spirit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，運動員還需要發揚團隊精神和拼搏精神。

sentences.english: There are many examples of success being achieved solely through the strong will of the spirit.
sentences.chinese: 有許多例子可以證明，具有拼搏精神才能成功。

sentences.english: Our mission demands that we always strive for more, in all that we do.
sentences.chinese: 我們的使命要求我們在所有工作中都要更加努力拼搏。

sentences.english: Where I have seen struggle, I have seen great strength.
sentences.chinese: 我看到的是人們的拼搏奮鬥和巨大的力量。

sentences.english: With the enterprising spirit of the people, remember to choose direction is more important than hard work.
sentences.chinese: 擁有實幹精神的人，切記選對方向比努力拼搏更重要。

sentences.english: Their spirit of hard-fighting move us .
sentences.chinese: 這些人用拼搏的精神感動着我們。

definition: to work hard/to try to make a living
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
